00002 #include <mylib.h>

00006 //#include <math.h>
00007 void rollMolecule(molecule* mol, double rad)
00008 {
00009   //Tells the user what's going on
00010   printf("Rolling molecule approx. %.0lf degrees...\n",(rad*57.2957795));
00011   int i,j;
00012   residue* curRes; atom* curAtm;
00013   coord_3D temp; temp.i = 0; temp.j = 0; temp.k = 0;
00014   for(i = 0; i < (*mol).nr; i++)
00015   {
00016    curRes = ((*mol).r+i);
00017  
00018    for(j = 0; j < (*curRes).na; j++)
00019    {
00020     curAtm = ((*curRes).a+j);
00021     //Rotating about the X-axis
00022     (*curAtm).x.i = (*curAtm).x.i;
00023     temp.j=((*curAtm).x.j*cos(rad))+((*curAtm).x.k*sin(rad));
00024     temp.k=((*curAtm).x.j*-sin(rad))+((*curAtm).x.k*cos(rad));
00025     (*curAtm).x.j = temp.j; (*curAtm).x.k = temp.k;
00026    }
00027   }
00028 }
00029 
00030 void pitchMolecule(molecule* mol, double rad)
00031 {
00032   //Tells the user what's going on
00033   printf("Pitching molecule approx. %.0lf degrees...\n",(rad*57.2957795));
00034   int i,j;
00035   residue* curRes; atom* curAtm;
00036   coord_3D temp; temp.i = 0; temp.j = 0; temp.k = 0;
00037   for(i = 0; i < (*mol).nr; i++)
00038   {
00039    curRes = ((*mol).r+i);
00040  
00041    for(j = 0; j < (*curRes).na; j++)
00042    {
00043     curAtm = ((*curRes).a+j);
00044     //Rotating about the Y-axis
00045     temp.i=((*curAtm).x.i*cos(rad))+((*curAtm).x.k*-sin(rad));
00046     (*curAtm).x.j = (*curAtm).x.j;
00047     temp.k=((*curAtm).x.i*sin(rad))+((*curAtm).x.k*cos(rad));
00048     (*curAtm).x.i = temp.i; (*curAtm).x.k = temp.k;
00049    }
00050   }
00051 }

00053 void yawMolecule(molecule* mol, double rad)
00054 {
00055   //Tells the user what's going on
00056   printf("Yawing molecule approx. %.0lf degrees...\n",(rad*57.2957795));
00057   int i,j;
00058   residue* curRes; atom* curAtm;
00059   coord_3D temp; temp.i = 0; temp.j = 0; temp.k = 0;
00060   for(i = 0; i < (*mol).nr; i++)
00061   {
00062    curRes = ((*mol).r+i);
00063  
00064    for(j = 0; j < (*curRes).na; j++)
00065    {
00066     curAtm = ((*curRes).a+j);
00067     //Rotating about the Z-axis
00068     temp.i=((*curAtm).x.i*cos(rad))+((*curAtm).x.j*sin(rad));
00069     temp.j=((*curAtm).x.i*-sin(rad))+((*curAtm).x.j*cos(rad));
00070     (*curAtm).x.i = temp.i; (*curAtm).x.j = temp.j;
00071     (*curAtm).x.k = (*curAtm).x.k;
00072 
00073    }
00074   }
00075 }
00076 void rollAssembly(assembly* asmbl, double rad)
00077 {
00078   //Tells the user what's going on
00079   printf("Rolling assembly approx. %.0lf degrees...\n",(rad*57.2957795));
00080   int i,j,k;
00081   molecule* mol; residue* curRes; atom* curAtm;
00082   coord_3D temp; temp.i = 0; temp.j = 0; temp.k = 0;
00083   for(k = 0; k < (*asmbl).nm; k++)
00084   {
00085    mol = ((*asmbl).m+k)[0]; // changed by BLF on 20080622 -- might need revisiting
00086    for(i = 0; i < (*mol).nr; i++)
00087    {
00088     curRes = ((*mol).r+i);
00089   
00090     for(j = 0; j < (*curRes).na; j++)
00091     {
00092      curAtm = ((*curRes).a+j);
00093      //Rotating about the X-axis
00094      (*curAtm).x.i = (*curAtm).x.i;
00095      temp.j=((*curAtm).x.j*cos(rad))+((*curAtm).x.k*sin(rad));
00096      temp.k=((*curAtm).x.j*-sin(rad))+((*curAtm).x.k*cos(rad));
00097      (*curAtm).x.j = temp.j; (*curAtm).x.k = temp.k;
00098     }
00099    }
00100   }
00101 }
